pageTitle: Internal Revenue Manual - 4.19.4 CAWR Reconciliation Balancing (Cont. 2)
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {28846=Adjust the Form 941, 943, 944 using reference codes IRN 115 or IRN 117 for wages and 116 or 296 for tax. See IRM 21.7.2.5.20.1. for more information., 178324=Generally, Form 941-X is filed to make corrections to CAWR related cases. Effective January 2009, Form 941-X, 943X, 944X, 945X, CT1X was introduced to replace Form 941-C. Form 941-C is now obsolete. The new Form(s) were developed to simplify the correction process for the tax payer and will better identify the changes being made for the tax examiner. A Form 941-X is not always necessary to correct the CAWR related case. Missing Forms W-2/W-2C may be needed to balance the case and ensure the taxpayer's employees received their earnings credits with SSA., 156573=The IRS-CAWR program compares the employer's data provided to the IRS on Forms 941, 943, 944, 945 or Schedule H to the data provided to SSA on Forms W-2/W-2C and/or to the IRS on Forms 1099-R and W-2G., 69554=If the taxpayer responds and only provides the SSN used for the Schedule H, research CC IMFOL to obtain the X-Ref TIN/EIN. If present on CC IMFOL, continue working the case. If not, refer to IRM 21.7.4.4.1.11 and IRM 21.6.4.4.8 , Business Tax Return and Non-Master File Accounts., 246846=For all tax years except 2011 and 2012 the Social Security tax rate is 12.4%. For 2011 and 2012 the Social Security rate is 10.4%., 138499=Refer to procedures in IRM 3.8.46, 3771=In the court case CSX Corporation v. United States, an opinion was issued regarding whether payments made pursuant to reduction in force programs are considered wages for purposes of FICA taxes and compensation for purposes of RRTA taxes. The Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit concluded that employment taxes apply to all payments at issue. See 518 F.3d 1328 (Fed Circuit 2008). These types of claims should be disallowed. See IRM 21.7.2.5.16CSX Claims and IRM 21.5.3.4.7.3.1Types of Protective Claims, for additional information., 128723=Research IDRS using all tools available to determine if the correct withholding has been reported on the original Form 1040 or if an amended Form 1040 was filed to correct the withholding., 147947=TY 2013 IRS-CAWR and TY 2012 SSA-CAWR programs processing benchmark dates are listed on the chart below., 7130=Send the Form(s) 941-X to the following address: Internal Revenue Service SBSE Compliance Services Mail Stop 4160 1973 N. Rulon White Blvd Ogden, UT 84404, 34657=If a TC 780/788 (unreversed by a TC 781) is present on any quarter of the tax year that you are working IRM 4.19.4.2.13., 139313=The "X" in each program code, represents the tax year being worked. However, don't use more than 2 years. Put any prior tax year with the oldest tax year for that code. For example, if you are working a late reply for TY 2007 IRS-CAWR and the current "X" represents the tax years on CAP (TY 2010, TY 2009, and TY 2008), use 18480 to report the time for the TY 2006 case. For IRS-CAWR and SSA-CAWR programs, tax examiners use:, 37644=For cases showing a debit and credit on the CAP money fields see Exhibit 4.19.4-4. If a Form 1040, U. S. Individual Income Tax Return, with a Schedule H was filed by the taxpayer, the MFT & ADJ Screen will have the corresponding MFT 30 and SSN information. Instructions for working the Schedule H are included in IRM 4.19.4.2.7., 209932=If the DLN is IDRS generated, this date will increment by 400, so January 15 would be shown as 415., 177472=Once the CAWR Unit assesses additional tax under the CAWR program, no interest free adjustment of such tax can be made by filing Form 941-X or by signing Form 2504 agreeing to the proposed deficiency., 6669=Send Letter 86C to inform the taxpayer their claim(s) are being rerouted and suspended. See (3), Step 5, Items (a), (b) and (c) in IRM 21.7.2.5.16.2 for information to be inserted in the letter., 31038=Adjust the Form 941, 943, 944 using IRN 115 or IRN 117 for wages and 116 or 296 for tax. See IRM 21.7.2.5.20.1. for more information., 86579=If the taxpayer provides an explanation citing a problem with their RAA (for TY 2001 only), check IDRS for the name of their Reporting Agent Authorization (RAA). There should be Forms W-2C processed.., 110223=See IRM 20.1.4.21.6.1, 26516=Under the Hiring Incentives to Restore Employment (HIRE) Act, enacted March 18, 2010, employers are provided a payroll tax exemption from the employer’s 6.2 percent share of social security tax on wages paid to qualifying employees. This is effective for wages paid from March 19, 2010 through December 31, 2010., 62330=Assess the discrepancy at 6.2% of the exempt wage difference using item adjustment code IRN 115 or IRN 117 for wages and 116 or 296 for tax on the quarter(s) where the exemption was taken. See IRM 21.7.2.5.20.1. for more information., 107274=The failure to deposit (FTD) penalty may be assessed whether or not the adjustment is interest free. Tiered penalty assessments for CAWR apply only to Forms 941, 943, 944, and 945. The additional penalty is assessed on TC 290 adjustments and interest free adjustments that are paid late. ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ ≡ If there is no FTD penalty, input TC 180.00 PRC 010 See IRM 20.1.4.21.6.1 Computation of the FTD Penalty (CAWR & FUTA Notices). Then follow the procedures below:, 118553=If a 6020(b) return is present and past due (it has been 5 months or more), and a Failure to File penalty is restricted on the module, increase the penalty by 25% of the TC 290. For returns due after July 30, 1996 (without regard to extensions), IRC Section 6651(g) provides that a 6020(b) return is treated the same as a return filed by a taxpayer for purposes of the Failure to Pay penalty. If not restricted make the assessment and IDRS will automatically make the adjustment to the penalty. See IRM 5.18.2, Business Returns IRC 6020(b) Processing, 128265=Baltimore, MD 21290-0300, 63472=Late replies occur when taxpayer correspondence is received after the initial case is closed on the CAP System. CAP will now open Late Replies into a SC 47 when the date is entered through the clerical "Replies/Undeliverables Recd" screen. All SC 47 cases will be manually closed on CAP using SC 43 when the late reply is worked. See IRM 21.3.3.4.17.1 (Preparation of Outgoing Correspondence), IRM 21.3.3.3.4 (Quality and Timely Responses), and IRM 21.3.3.4.1 (Case Control and Inventory management) to determine if additional correspondence is required., 46541=If a TC 780/788 (unreversed by a TC 781) is present on any module of the tax year that you are working IRM 4.19.4.2.13., 26858=CAWR is now matching the wages reported as subject to the exemption on the employer's Form 941 line 6c and 12d, Form 943 line 7b and 13d, Form 944 line 5b and 11d against what is reported on the Forms W-2 on line 12b using code "CC" . IRM 21.7.2.5.20., 72798=If the taxpayer responds and only provides the SSN used for the Schedule H, research CC IMFOL to obtain the X-Ref TIN/EIN. If present on CC IMFOL, continue working the case. If not, refer to IRM 21.7.4.4.1.11, Business Tax Return and Non-Master File Accounts and IRM 21.6.4.4.8 ., 124402=Reapply the HIRE exempt wages and tax on the quarters it was originally removed from using item adjustment code IRN 115 or IRN 117 for wages and 116 or 296 for tax. See IRM 21.7.2.5.20.1. for more information., 126372=This IRM 4.19.4.8 addresses IMF cases that are identified as a result of an employer submitting amended Forms W-2 (W-2C) that increases or decreases their amount of Federal Tax Withheld. Contact must be made to their individual employees to notify them that a change to their 1040 may need to be made., 45011=Assess the discrepancy at 6.2% of the exempt wage difference using item adjustment code IRN 115 or IRN 117 for wages and 116 or 296 for tax on the quarters here the HIRE exemption was taken.. See IRM 21.7.2.5.20.1. for more information.}
textBeforeTable: If a reply includes Form(s) 941-C/941-X claiming severance pay and/or supplemental unemployment compensation pay not subject to Social Security or Medicare tax: See IRM 4.19.4.7 Assess and close the case using the appropriate assessment needed case processing procedures. If a reply is received (correspondence only) claiming severance pay and/or supplemental unemployment compensation pay is not subject to Social Security or Medicare tax, take the following actions: In the court case CSX Corporation v. United States, an opinion was issued regarding whether payments made pursuant to reduction in force programs are considered wages for purposes of FICA taxes and compensation for purposes of RRTA taxes. The Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit concluded that employment taxes apply to all payments at issue. See 518 F.3d 1328 (Fed Circuit 2008). These types of claims should be disallowed. See IRM 21.7.2.5.16CSX Claims and IRM 21.5.3.4.7.3.1Types of Protective Claims, for additional information. 4.19.4.3.44  (04-04-2013) Replies Citing CSX Claims 4.19.4.3  Replies Exhibit 4.19.4-5   Physical Inventory Certification Exhibit 4.19.4-4   Tax and Penalty Assessment Guide Exhibit 4.19.4-3   Glossary of Acronyms and of Terms Exhibit 4.19.4-2   Closed Case Status Codes Exhibit 4.19.4-1   Assigned
textAfterTable: If research verifies that this condition is due to a Successor/Predecessor situation Enter the x-ref EIN into the x-ref field on the CAP detail screen. File Correspondence following the applicable No Assessment needed case processing procedures. See IRM 4.19.4.7. 4.19.4.3.46  (04-01-2011) Replies With Disaster Indicators on CAP The following information applies to CAWR replies with a Disaster indicator present on the CAP Detail Screen. CAWR disaster coordinators input Zip Codes for specific declared disaster area situations as necessary based on IRS Disaster Relief Memos. Access http://www.tris.irs.gov/fema/ to retrieve the beginning and ending date of the disaster period. Reminder: The -S freeze does not suppress notices. Continue normal case processing. If ... And ... Then ... The reply is received with information balancing the case.
